admin.help: Configure how the FortiGate operating as a wireless controller discovers and manages this WTP, AP or FortiAP.
admin.name: admin

options.help: FortiGate wireless controller discovers the WTP, AP, or FortiAP though discovery or join request messages.
options.name: discovered

options.help: FortiGate wireless controller is configured to not provide service to this WTP.
options.name: disable

options.help: FortiGate wireless controller is configured to provide service to this WTP.
options.name: enable

allowaccess.help: Control management access to the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP. Separate entries with a space.
allowaccess.name: allowaccess

firmware-provision.help: Firmware version to provision to this FortiAP on bootup (major.minor.build, i.e. 6.2.1234).
firmware-provision.name: firmware-provision

firmware-provision-latest.help: Enable/disable one-time automatic provisioning of the latest firmware version.
firmware-provision-latest.name: firmware-provision-latest

options.help: Do not automatically provision the latest available firmware.
options.name: disable

options.help: Automatically attempt a one-time upgrade to the latest available firmware version.
options.name: once

options.help: Enable WTP image download at join time.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable WTP image download at join time.
options.name: disable

ip-fragment-preventing.help: Method(s) by which IP fragmentation is prevented for control and data packets through CAPWAP tunnel (default = tcp-mss-adjust).
ip-fragment-preventing.name: ip-fragment-preventing

options.help: Drop packet and send ICMP Destination Unreachable
options.name: icmp-unreachable

options.help: NAT WTP ESL port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP ESL port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP ESL port to SSID.
options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.help: NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: nat-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.help: NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to SSID.
options.name: bridge-to-ssid

options.help: NAT WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: nat-to-wan

options.help: Bridge WTP LAN port to WTP WAN port.
options.name: bridge-to-wan

options.name: bridge-to-ssid

led-state.help: Enable to allow the FortiAPs LEDs to light. Disable to keep the LEDs off. You may want to keep the LEDs off so they are not distracting in low light areas etc.
led-state.name: led-state

options.help: Allow the LEDs on this FortiAP to light.
options.name: enable

options.help: Keep the LEDs on this FortiAP off.
options.name: disable

location.help: Field for describing the physical location of the WTP, AP or FortiAP.
location.name: location

login-passwd.help: Set the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP's administrator password.
login-passwd.name: login-passwd

login-passwd-change.help: Change or reset the administrator password of a managed WTP, FortiAP or AP (yes, default, or no, default = no).
login-passwd-change.name: login-passwd-change

options.help: Change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password. Use the login-password option to set the password.
options.name: yes

options.help: Keep the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password set to the factory default.
options.name: default

options.help: Do not change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password.
options.name: no

mesh-bridge-enable.help: Enable/disable mesh Ethernet bridge when WTP is configured as a mesh branch/leaf AP.
mesh-bridge-enable.name: mesh-bridge-enable

options.help: Use mesh Ethernet bridge local setting on the WTP.
options.name: default

options.help: Turn on mesh Ethernet bridge on the WTP.
options.name: enable

options.help: Turn off mesh Ethernet bridge on the WTP.
options.name: disable

name.help: WTP, AP or FortiAP configuration name.
name.name: name

override-allowaccess.help: Enable to override the WTP profile management access configuration.
override-allowaccess.name: override-allowaccess

options.help: Override the WTP profile management access configuration.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile management access configuration.
options.name: disable

override-ip-fragment.help: Enable/disable overriding the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
override-ip-fragment.name: override-ip-fragment

options.help: Override the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile IP fragment prevention setting.
options.name: disable

override-lan.help: Enable to override the WTP profile LAN port setting.
override-lan.name: override-lan

options.help: Override the WTP profile LAN port setting.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile LAN port setting.
options.name: disable

override-led-state.help: Enable to override the profile LED state setting for this FortiAP. You must enable this option to use the led-state command to turn off the FortiAP's LEDs.
override-led-state.name: override-led-state

options.help: Override the WTP profile LED state.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile LED state.
options.name: disable

override-login-passwd-change.help: Enable to override the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
override-login-passwd-change.name: override-login-passwd-change

options.help: Override the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the the WTP profile login-password (administrator password) setting.
options.name: disable

override-split-tunnel.help: Enable/disable overriding the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
override-split-tunnel.name: override-split-tunnel

options.help: Override the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile split tunneling setting.
options.name: disable

override-wan-port-mode.help: Enable/disable overriding the wan-port-mode in the WTP profile.
override-wan-port-mode.name: override-wan-port-mode

options.help: Use the wan-port-mode in the WTP profile.
options.name: disable

auto-power-high.help: The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-high.name: auto-power-high

auto-power-level.help: Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
auto-power-level.name: auto-power-level

auto-power-low.help: The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-low.name: auto-power-low

auto-power-target.help: Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).
auto-power-target.name: auto-power-target

band.help: WiFi band that Radio 1 operates on.
band.name: band

channel.help: Selected list of wireless radio channels.
channel.name: channel

drma-manual-mode.help: Radio mode to be used for DRMA manual mode (default = ncf).
drma-manual-mode.name: drma-manual-mode

options.help: Set the radio to AP mode.
options.name: ap

options.help: Set the radio to monitor mode
options.name: monitor

options.help: Select and set the radio mode based on NCF score.
options.name: ncf

options.help: Select the radio mode based on NCF score, but do not apply.
options.name: ncf-peek

override-analysis.help: Enable to override the WTP profile spectrum analysis configuration.
override-analysis.name: override-analysis

options.help: Override the WTP profile spectrum analysis configuration.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile spectrum analysis configuration.
options.name: disable

override-band.help: Enable to override the WTP profile band setting.
override-band.name: override-band

options.help: Override the WTP profile band setting.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile band setting.
options.name: disable

override-channel.help: Enable to override WTP profile channel settings.
override-channel.name: override-channel

override-txpower.help: Enable to override the WTP profile power level configuration.
override-txpower.name: override-txpower

options.help: Override the WTP profile power level configuration.
options.name: enable

options.help: Use the WTP profile power level configuration.
options.name: disable

override-vaps.help: Enable to override WTP profile Virtual Access Point (VAP) settings.
override-vaps.name: override-vaps

power-level.help: Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-level.name: power-level

power-mode.help: Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
power-mode.name: power-mode

options.help: Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
options.name: dBm

options.help: Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
options.name: percentage

power-value.help: Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
power-value.name: power-value

spectrum-analysis.help: Enable/disable spectrum analysis to find interference that would negatively impact wireless performance.
spectrum-analysis.name: spectrum-analysis

vap-all.help: Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
vap-all.name: vap-all

vaps.help: Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
vaps.name: vaps

auto-power-target.help: Target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (-95 to -20, default = -70).
auto-power-target.name: auto-power-target

vap-all.name: vap-all

vaps.name: vaps

region.help: Region name WTP is associated with.
region.name: region

dest-ip.help: Destination IP and mask for the split-tunneling subnet.
dest-ip.name: dest-ip

split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet.help: Enable/disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL (default = disable).
split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet.name: split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet

options.help: Enable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
options.name: disable

split-tunneling-acl-path.help: Split tunneling ACL path is local/tunnel.
split-tunneling-acl-path.name: split-tunneling-acl-path

options.help: Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be tunnel.
options.name: tunnel

options.help: Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be local NATed.
options.name: local

tun-mtu-downlink.help: The MTU of downlink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-downlink.name: tun-mtu-downlink

tun-mtu-uplink.help: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of uplink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-uplink.name: tun-mtu-uplink

uuid.help: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).
uuid.name: uuid

wan-port-mode.help: Enable/disable using the FortiAP WAN port as a LAN port.
wan-port-mode.name: wan-port-mode

options.help: Use the FortiAP WAN port as a LAN port.
options.name: wan-lan

options.help: Do not use the WAN port as a LAN port.
options.name: wan-only

wtp-mode.help: WTP, AP, or FortiAP operating mode; normal (by default) or remote. A tunnel mode SSID can be assigned to an AP in normal mode but not remote mode, while a local-bridge mode SSID can be assigned to an AP in either normal mode or remote mode.
wtp-mode.name: wtp-mode

wtp-profile.help: WTP profile name to apply to this WTP, AP or FortiAP.
wtp-profile.name: wtp-profile

results.help: Configure Wireless Termination Points (WTPs), that is, FortiAPs or APs to be managed by FortiGate.
results.name: wtp
